title: BOOKSTORE / HJELMSERIES
description: A shelf full of Hjelmdall books. There are so many.

dialogueTree.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "The display rack is brimming with w..."
dialogueTree.text: The display rack is brimming with worn paperbacks featuring an extremely muscular, sword-wielding barbarian on the cover. Nearly all the titles contain the word *Hjelmdall* somewhere.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "This is entirely, *completely* you...."
links.text: This is entirely, *completely* you. You have found the *right* books.

links.title: You: ""Storekeep, tell me about the muscl..."
links.text: "Storekeep, tell me about the muscleman books."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, *Man from Hjelmdall*. A very p..."
links.text: "Oh, *Man from Hjelmdall*. A very popular series of adventure novels." She looks at the book with some disdain. "They're awfully immoral and violent books."

links.title: You: ""Who's this Man from Hjelmdall?""
links.text: "Who's this Man from Hjelmdall?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""He's a 'hero' from the frozen nort..."
links.text: "He's a 'hero' from the frozen northlands. He travels to all sorts of lands and mainly kills people. There are hundreds of books in the series... and they sell incredibly well."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's pulp adventure. Takes place in..."
links.text: It's pulp adventure. Takes place in a faux-mythological non-place called Hjelmdall. There is no such region on the Katla isola.

links.title: You: ""Why are they so popular?""
links.text: "Why are they so popular?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Blood and violence, scantily clad..."
links.text: "Blood and violence, scantily clad women, epic narratives, all those mystical things he encounters. They're bound to grab those with little imagination and nothing to do."

links.title: You: ""Sounds good. Which one should I st..."
links.text: "Sounds good. Which one should I start with?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""What does it matter? They're all t..."
links.text: "What does it matter? They're all the same." She rolls her eyes, then fiddles with her pendant. "However, the customer is always right, they say."

links.title: Plaisance: ""If you're a novice of the series,..."
links.text: "If you're a novice of the series, I'd recommend 'Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall.' It's supposed to be a good introduction to the series."

links.title: You: ""That doesn't sound like something..."
links.text: "That doesn't sound like something I'd be interested in."

links.title: Plaisance: ""At last, someone sensible..." She..."
links.text: "At last, someone sensible..." She fiddles with her pendant. "However, I still urge you to buy one. Can't judge a book by the cover, they say!"

links.title: You: ""Wow, more Hjelmdall...""
links.text: "Wow, more Hjelmdall..."

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall: "Mountains of it. Heroic quantities..."
links.text: Mountains of it. Heroic quantities of Hjelmdall. Roy's puny shirt is nothing compared to the *real deal*.

links.title: You: "Look through the display of books."
links.text: Look through the display of books.

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "Rows and rows of Hjelmdallermenn bl..."
links.text: Rows and rows of Hjelmdallermenn blur your vision. You make out some titles: "Man from Hjelmdall and the Mammoth-Riders", "Man from Hjelmdall: Return to Hjelmdall", and the solipsistic "Man From Hjelmdall and the Hjelmdall Man."

links.title: You: "Good god, how many are there?"
links.text: Good god, how many are there?

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "Maybe a hundred? "Man from Hjelmdal..."
links.text: Maybe a hundred? "Man from Hjelmdall and the Sages at the End of the World", "Man from Hjelmdall and the False-God", "Man from Hjelmdall and the Scorched Earth", "Man from Hjelmdall: The Hjelmdall Colonies", "Man from Hjelmdall and the Swamp Beast", "Man from Hjelmdall and the Snow Crabs."

links.title: Half Light: "Those snow crabs are worse than the..."
links.text: Those snow crabs are worse than they sound.

links.title: You: "Is that all?"
links.text: Is that all?

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "Not even close! "Man from Hjelmdall..."
links.text: Not even close! "Man from Hjelmdall in Hell", "Man from Hjelmdall and the Forest of Slaves", "Man from Hjelmdall Under the Lake", "Man from Hjelmdall: Hjelmdall Burning". There's even "The Trial of Death", a Pasternal combat game book set in the world of Hjelmdallermann, and so much more.

links.title: You: "Enough."
links.text: Enough.

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "The display rack before you is burd..."
links.text: The display rack before you is burdened under piles of Man from Hjelmdall novels.

links.title: You: "Do any of the books call out to me?"
links.text: Do any of the books call out to me?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "A twinge at the back of your head m..."
links.text: A twinge at the back of your head makes you flinch. Your eye starts twitching.

links.title: You: "Ow!"
links.text: Ow!

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "Your hand reaches toward a book wit..."
links.text: Your hand reaches toward a book with glossy cover art of the very muscular Man from Hjelmdall -- in *chains* -- kneeling in front of a staircase leading to a throne. A woman sits on the throne, leering at the man.

links.title: Inland Empire: "She's laughing at him. Belittling h..."
links.text: She's laughing at him. Belittling him.

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "Between the throne and the Hjelmdal..."
links.text: Between the throne and the Hjelmdallermann lies a bonfire, casting shadows on the wall. The shadow of the woman's head-dress looks like a pair of devil horns. The title reads: "Man from Hjelmdall and the Devil Woman".

links.title: You: "Hmm, aren't all women devil women?"
links.text: Hmm, aren't all women devil women?

links.title: Man from Hjelmdall Series: "Especially those leering types who..."
links.text: Especially those leering types who seem to wear nothing but an armoured bikini. There's also some sort of a snake-lizard beast slithering around her abdomen-chest-shoulder region.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's symbolic of vice and sin."
links.text: It's symbolic of vice and sin.

links.title: You: ""Storekeep, this book is misogynist..."
links.text: "Storekeep, this book is misogynistic. How can you peddle such filth?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The entire series is also *endeari..."
links.text: "The entire series is also *endearingly* racist, if I may add."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, sir, I know." The storekeep ap..."
links.text: "Oh, sir, I know." The storekeep apologizes immediately. "This really isn't representative of our values. But the store has to cater to its customers."

links.title: You: "Interesting."
links.text: Interesting.

links.title: You: "Ugh, what is it?"
links.text: Ugh, what is it?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Nothing of interest. Only silence a..."
links.text: Nothing of interest. Only silence and the cosmic background pain-radiation.

links.title: You: ""I want to buy the 'Hjelmdallermann..."
links.text: "I want to buy the 'Hjelmdallermann' book."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh yes, certainly." She rubs her h..."
links.text: "Oh yes, certainly." She rubs her hands together. "Another good sale."

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "You've acquired an interactable ite..."
links.text: You've acquired an interactable item. Investigate this item further by going to the INTERACT tab in your INVENTORY.

links.title: You: ""I want to buy 'Man from Hjelmdall..."
links.text: "I want to buy 'Man from Hjelmdall and the Devil Woman'."

links.title: Plaisance: "She nudges her glasses. "It *is* a..."
links.text: She nudges her glasses. "It *is* a best-seller for a reason."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
